Package network.rmi.client

Class NetworkManager

java.lang.Object
network.rmi.client.NetworkManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
NetworkManagerInterface
public class NetworkManager extends Object implements NetworkManagerInterface
Class the handles the server-client communications, server-side

      Returns:

    • run

      public void run()
      Method that contains a loop that runs as long as the connection is still active. Within the loop, it checks if a `clientService` is present and sends a ping request if a certain amount of time has elapsed since the last message. It also checks for any server events and adds them to an `eventQueue`. Finally, it notifies the `NetworkManager` instance that an event has occurred. If an exception is caught, it disconnects from the server.

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect()
      Method that checks if the object is connected, then sets the `connected` flag to false. It then adds a `ServerDisconnect` event to the `eventQueue` and notifies all threads waiting on the `instance` object. The `synchronized` keyword ensures that only one thread can execute this method at a time.
      Specified by:
      disconnect in interface NetworkManagerInterface

    • reconnect

      public void reconnect() throws Exception
      Method that attempts to reconnect to a server using the `serverInfo` object, and if it is not null, it calls the `connect()` method with the `serverInfo` parameter. If the `serverInfo` object is null, it throws a `ClientNeverConnectedException`.
      Specified by:
      reconnect in interface NetworkManagerInterface
      Throws:
      Exception - if the client wasn't connected to the server before

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      Method that return a boolean value indicating whether the object is currently connected or not.
      Specified by:
      isConnected in interface NetworkManagerInterface
      Returns:
      connected.

    • getEvent

      public Optional<ServerEvent> getEvent()
      Method that returns an `Optional` object containing a `ServerEvent` object. The method is synchronized to ensure thread safety. It uses the `poll()` method of the `eventQueue` object to retrieve and remove the first element of the queue, and returns it wrapped in an `Optional` object. If the queue is empty, it returns an empty `Optional`.
      Specified by:
      getEvent in interface NetworkManagerInterface
      Returns:
      an `Optional` object containing a `ServerEvent` object.

    • hasEvent

      public boolean hasEvent()
      Method that returns a boolean value indicating whether the `eventQueue` is empty or not.
      Specified by:
      hasEvent in interface NetworkManagerInterface
      Returns:
      true if the `eventQueue` is empty, false otherwise.

    • lobbyList

      public Function<Boolean,ArrayList<Lobby>> lobbyList() throws Exception
      Method that returns a function that takes a boolean value and returns an ArrayList of Lobby objects. It throws an exception if an error occurs. The function is created by calling the handleService method with a new Function object that takes a boolean value of TRUE and a Service value of LobbyList.
      Specified by:
      lobbyList in interface NetworkManagerInterface
      Returns:

The method calls the `handleService` method with a `Function` object that takes the `LobbyCreateInfo` object and a `Service` enum value as input. The `handleService` method is responsible for processing the request and returning the appropriate response.

    • lobbyJoin

      public Function<String,Lobby> lobbyJoin(String lobbyName) throws Exception
      Method that takes a `String` parameter called `lobbyName` and returns a `Function` that maps a `String` to a `Lobby` object. The method throws an `Exception` if an error occurs. The `handleService` method is called with a new `Function` object that takes the `lobbyName` parameter and a `Service` enum value called `LobbyJoin`. The purpose of this method is to handle a service request to join a lobby with the specified name.
      Specified by:
      lobbyJoin in interface NetworkManagerInterface
      Parameters:
      lobbyName - the name of the lobby to join

The purpose of this method is to handle a service request to update a lobby.

The purpose of this method is to handle a service request to select a card.

    • exitGame

      public Function<Boolean,Boolean> exitGame() throws Exception

The `Function` object is created with the parameters `true` and `Service.ExitGame`. The `handleService()` method is responsible for handling the `Service` object passed to it and returning a `Boolean` value. The purpose of this method is to handle a service request to exit the game.
